TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: 001 izua aya tua ku milimilingan, izua aya zua marałak a ti

S.FORM: izua maḍusaḍusa selapay nu nasepułu aravats, aya.
izoa madrosadrosa selapay no nasepoljo aravac, aya.
S.TRANSL: With only the two of them they were extremely lonely, they say.

S.FORM: "qai, qunu, qai mai sapułu itjen.
"qai, qono, qai mai sapoljo itjen.
S.TRANSL: “Well, son, we are lonely.

S.FORM: qai muri tjemavang itjen tua vaung tua lizuk tua gadu," aya tiamadju a marałak, aya.
qai mori tjemavang itjen toa vaong toa lizok toa gado," aya tiamadjo a maraljak, aya.
S.TRANSL: Now we’ll make the sea, the plains and the mountains,” said the parent and child, they say.

S.FORM: manu izuanga nakipalinguł a vaung.
mano izoanga nakipalingolj a vaong.
S.TRANSL: So then there was the sea all around.

S.FORM: izuanga tiamadju itua tjałavavavan a gadu a tjemavatjavang tua vaung tua lizuk tua gadu, aya.
izoanga tiamadjo itoa tjaljavavavan a gado a tjemavatjavang toa vaong toa lizok toa gado, aya.
S.TRANSL: There they were on the highest mountain making the sea, the plains and the mountains, they say.

S.FORM: "qai qai, muri pułaułaung itjen tua maretimałimałi a kasiw a venutsiatsiar a venangavangał tua kakanen a mareka kaizuazua," aya uta, aya.
"qai qai, mori poljaoljaong itjen toa maretimaljimalji a kasiw a venociaciar a venangavangalj toa kakanen a mareka kaizoazoa," aya ota, aya.
S.TRANSL: “Well we’ll get shade from the various kinds of trees that have blossom and bear fruit for food of all kinds(?),” they said too, they say.

S.FORM: manu izuanga uta naseleman anga a gadu a kasiw matatukalulum anga matatuzarzarzar anga vutsiar, aya.
mano izoanga ota naseleman anga a gado a kasiw matatokalolom anga matatozarzarzar anga vociar, aya.
S.TRANSL: And so the mountains became shaded (?); trees got ripe in turn and the blossoms became bright in turn, they say.

S.FORM: nuka tsemel anga tsinuvuqan anga sepełuq a kana qipuqipu anga, aya.
noka cemel anga cinovoqan anga sepeljoq a kana qipoqipo anga, aya.
S.TRANSL: Grass too sprang up, and all the ground was full up, they say.

S.FORM: manu "qai muri pukuku itjen, qunu, tua qemuzimuzip tua qayaqayam tua łemangułanguy i taladj tua vaung," manu aya uta tiamadju a marałak, aya.
mano "qai mori pokoko itjen, qono, toa qemozimozip toa qayaqayam toa ljemangoljangoy i taladj toa vaong," mano aya ota tiamadjo a maraljak, aya.
S.TRANSL: Then “Now we’ll have pets, child; animals, birds and things that swim in the sea,” the parent and child also said, they say.

S.FORM: saka tjikezem, manu ka tsimeraw izuanga uta; nekanga nuka ita ika izua.
saka tjikezem, mano ka cimeraw izoanga ota; nekanga noka ita ika izoa.
S.TRANSL: So they closed their eyes, and when they opened them, there it all was; there was not a thing missing;

S.FORM: nekanga nu kinaqusaw tua kuku, aya.
nekanga no kinaqosaw toa koko, aya.
S.TRANSL: they weren’t missing any pets, they say.

S.FORM: saka izuanga tiamadju a talidulidu sakamaya, aya.
saka izoanga tiamadjo a talidolido sakamaya, aya.
S.TRANSL: So there they were just enjoying themselves, they say.

S.FORM: "qai, qunu, djavadjavay łakua ku pai sa-u ḍi, łizavu a tja sikataqałan i tjariteku," ayain ti Pulelelelengan nua zua kama ti Kułełełełe, aya.
"qai, qono, djavadjavay ljakoa ko pai sa-o dri, ljizavo a tja sikataqaljan i tjariteko," ayain ti Polelelelengan noa zoa kama ti Koljeljeljelje, aya.
S.TRANSL: “Now, child, I’m sorry but off you go and see our fellows in the world below,” said father Kułełełełe to Pulelelelengan, they say.

S.FORM: "manu ika na ku łizaven ḍi, kama, ki kemudakuda?" aya ti Pulelelelengan, aya.
"mano ika na ko ljizaven dri, kama, ki kemodakoda?" aya ti Polelelelengan, aya.
S.TRANSL: So “If I go to see them,(?) father, what am I to do?” said Pulelelelengan, they say.

S.FORM: qau "ui, djavadjavay, łakua sa-u kivakini ki pasemalaw a tja sikataqałan, qunu.
qao "oi, djavadjavay, ljakoa sa-o kivakini ki pasemalaw a tja sikataqaljan, qono.
S.TRANSL: “Yes, I’m sorry, but go; our fellows will tell you, child.

S.FORM: łakua maya patjekutjekuł tua tjelu a puluq a qadaw, ḍi, sa su pangtjez sa su kitsepeliw a sema maza," aya ti Kułełełełe tua zua ałak a ti Pulelelelengan a pazazekazekatj, aya.
ljakoa maya patjekotjekolj toa tjelo a poloq a qadaw, dri, sa so pangtjez sa so kicepeliw a sema maza," aya ti Koljeljeljelje toa zoa aljak a ti Polelelelengan a pazazekazekatj, aya.
S.TRANSL: But don’t stay longer than 30 days and come back here,” ordered Kułełełełe to his child Pulelelelengan, they say.

S.FORM: sa vaik ti Pulelelelengan a łemizaw tua i tjariteku, aya.
sa vaik ti Polelelelengan a ljemizaw toa i tjariteko, aya.
S.TRANSL: So Pulelelelengan went to visit the world below, they say.

S.FORM: manu zemuker i tjariteku maka tjaia Muatjukutjuku azua ti Pulelelelengan, aya.
mano zemoker i tjariteko maka tjaia Moatjokotjoko azoa ti Polelelelengan, aya.
S.TRANSL: And Pulelelelengan arrived in the world below by way of the Muatjukutjuku house, they say.

S.FORM: manu ka zemuker anga, "kełu, ła sikataqałan.
mano ka zemoker anga, "keljo, lja sikataqaljan.
S.TRANSL: And when he had arrived, he kept saying: “Come here, fellow villagers,

S.FORM: qa kełu satjaiqayavu tjanuaken.
qa keljo satjaiqayavo tjanoaken.
S.TRANSL: come to me.

S.FORM: ku nu tjautsikelay ku nu pasemalavay," ayaya timadju.
ko no tjaocikelay ko no pasemalavay," ayaya timadjo.
S.TRANSL: I will speak to you and explain to you.”

S.FORM: sa qepuqepu-i(?) a setjariteku, sa pasekełangi tua nanguaqan nua kinaizuanan, tua izua kama nimadju a tjałakiłivakan, nu ayaya, qai ka sekełang anga a i tjariteku, "qu manu kemuda a nu izua tjananguaq tua tja kinaizuanan, a nu izua rukiłivakan aravats," aya zua setjariteku, aya.

sa qepoqepo-i(?) a setjariteko, sa pasekeljangi toa nangoaqan noa kinaizoanan, toa izoa kama nimadjo a tjaljakiljivakan, no ayaya, qai ka sekeljang anga a i tjariteko, "qo mano kemoda a no izoa tjanangoaq toa tja kinaizoanan, a no izoa rokiljivakan aravac," aya zoa setjariteko, aya.
S.TRANSL: So he gathered the people of the world below, and explained to them the goodness of his place, and about his most loving father. And when the people of the world below understood this, they said: “So that’s how it is; so there is a place better than our place, and there is someone really loving,” said the people of the world below, they say.

S.FORM: saka a(?) mapuzangal anga tua patsun tua sema tjarivavaw, aya.
saka a(?) mapozangal anga toa pacon toa sema tjarivavaw, aya.
S.TRANSL: And they longed to see and to get to the world above, they say.

S.FORM: "qai, ła sikataqałan, patjatjautsiketsikelu anga ḍi, pasekełangu anga a ika nakiqepu a ika ku sintsevungan(?) ḍi; uła mun a kemłang a mapułat tua kiłivak ni kama, tua nanguaqan nua i tjarivavaw," aya ti Kułe-Pulelelelengan.

"qai, lja sikataqaljan, patjatjaocikecikelo anga dri, pasekeljango anga a ika nakiqepo a ika ko sincevongan(?) dri; olja mon a kemljang a mapoljat toa kiljivak ni kama, toa nangoaqan noa i tjarivavaw," aya ti Kolje-Polelelelengan.
S.TRANSL: “Fellow villagers, tell one another; explain to the people who didn’t turn up, whom I haven’t met; so that you will all know the love of my father and the goodness of the world above,” said Kułe-Pulelelelengan.

S.FORM: sa vaik a kitsepeliw a sema tua kama i tjarivavaw, aya.
sa vaik a kicepeliw a sema toa kama i tjarivavaw, aya.
S.TRANSL: And he went back to his father in the world above, they say.

S.FORM: sa tjautsiketsikel anga tua kama a łemitałita tua kinaitjaritekuan ti Pulelelelengan, aya.
sa tjaocikecikel anga toa kama a ljemitaljita toa kinaitjaritekoan ti Polelelelengan, aya.
S.TRANSL: And Pulelelelengan told his father everything that he had done in the world below, they say.

S.FORM: selapay nu namalevaleva aravats a "manu izua nanguaq matu sa tja kinaizuanan, manu zua izua mamazangiłan aravats a rukiłivak," aya setjariteku.
selapay no namalevaleva aravac a "mano izoa nangoaq mato sa tja kinaizoanan, mano zoa izoa mamazangiljan aravac a rokiljivak," aya setjariteko.
S.TRANSL: And the people were very glad. “So there is something good like our own place. And there is a real chief who is truly loving,” said the people of the world below,

S.FORM: saka namalevanga aravats, saka sa su u iravaravanga sa su(?) kalevalevanga tua sema tjarivavaw a kitjavilił tua ti Pulelelelengan, aya.
saka namalevanga aravac, saka sa so o iravaravanga sa so(?) kalevalevanga toa sema tjarivavaw a kitjavililj toa ti Polelelelengan, aya.
S.TRANSL: and they were very glad, “So get ready and be glad to go to the world above following Pulelelelengan,” they said (?).
